{{cpp/filesystem/directory_entry/title|path}}
{{cpp/filesystem/directory_entry/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|since=c++17|1=
const std::filesystem::path&amp; path() const noexcept;
}}
{{dcl|since=c++17|1=
operator const std::filesystem::path&amp; () const noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns the full path the directory entry refers to.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
The full path the directory entry refers to.

===Example===
{{example
|std=cxx17
|code=
#include &lt;filesystem&gt;
#include &lt;fstream&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

namespace fs = std::filesystem;

std::string get_stem(const fs::path&amp; p) { return p.stem().string(); }
void create_file(const fs::path&amp; p) { std::ofstream o{p}; }

int main()
{
    const fs::path dir{"tmp_dir"};
    fs::create_directory(dir);
    create_file(dir / "one");
    create_file(dir / "two");
    create_file(dir / "three");

    for (const auto&amp; file : fs::directory_iterator(dir))
    {
        // Explicit conversion
        std::cout &lt;&lt; get_stem(file.path()) &lt;&lt; '\n';

        // Implicit conversion
        std::cout &lt;&lt; get_stem(file) &lt;&lt; '\n';
    }

    fs::remove_all(dir);
}
|p=true
|output=
two
two
one
one
three
three
}}
